symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.pattern: Often initial symptom, progressing in severity

symptoms.name: Ophthalmologic symptoms
symptoms.pattern: Range from pain, ptosis, and proptosis to ophthalmoplegia and blindness

symptoms.name: Lethargy
symptoms.pattern: Can be present in later stages

risk_factors: Immunosuppression (e.g., following organ transplantation, hematologic malignancies)
Recent COVID-19 infection with steroid treatment

imaging_findings.MRI: Sinonasal and cavernous sinus invasive fungal infiltration; Temporal lobe abscess; Frontal lobe abscess; Frontal bone osteomyelitis; Cavernous sinus thrombosis; Multiple infarcts; Internal carotid artery thrombosis; Cribriform plate osteomyelitis; Pachymeningitis; Extensive skull base osteomyelitis; Mucormycosis associated ICA bifurcation aneurysm

required: Clinical presentation consistent with rhinocerebral mucormycosis (e.g., headache, facial/orbital pain, ophthalmologic symptoms)
supportive: Imaging findings suggestive of sinusitis with intracranial extension
Risk factors for mucormycosis (e.g., diabetes, immunosuppression)
